Installation¶

To install pyodine, the only way right now is to simply download or clone it from its Gitlab repository:

$ git clone https://gitlab.com/Heeren/pyodine.git

Now you can use it by importing it into your own Python code where needed (check out the Tutorial section on how to import and use it: Prepare the environment).

Of course you should make sure that you have all dependencies installed - these will only be Python packages:

Important

List of required packages :

  • astropy >= 4.2.1

  • h5py >= 2.10.0

  • numpy >= 1.20.1

  • lmfit >= 1.0.2

  • barycorrpy >= 0.4.4

  • pathos >= 0.2.8

  • argparse >= 1.1

  • matplotlib >= 3.3.4

  • progressbar2 >= 3.37.1

  • dill >= 0.3.4

pyodine
